The Corral Reef is a massive underwater ridge system.
It is located in the Coral Sea, off the coast of Queensland, Australia.
The reef system is made up of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands.
The Great Barrier Reef, the world's largest coral reef system, is part of the Corral Reef.
The area is known for its rich marine biodiversity and is a popular destination for scuba diving and snorkeling.
